Description: Seven irregularly-shaped fragments of a dark brown, blue, natural, red-brown and red wool textile. The yarns are 's'-spun and 's'-plied. Four of the seven fragments show no woven features. One fragment (85.2.45.2) was mended in antiquity. Another fragment (85.2.45.3) has a reinforced selvedge and a band of red and natural coloured wefts bordered on each side by a 10mm wide blue band. Blue yarn is present in the selvedge and suggests the presence of 2 additional blue bands now missing. A third fragment (85.2.45.6) has an area of blue wefts with traces of embroidery in natural and brown colour. A small dark brown, wool tassel is attached to it. A cloth fragment (85.2.45.7) was sewn to 85.2.45.6 and contains the remains of a band of blue, natural and brown wefts.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kulubnarti, 21-S-2 Fill outside NE wall of F2
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 85.2.45 (excavation object cat. no.)
